page.title: 15ECOLOGY (CONT)
page.content: The field boundaries mainly consist of {dry_stone dykes}which are covered with {moss and lichen.}The majority of the natural vegetation follows the lines of the field boundaries and roadsides. This mainly consists of{grass,ground_ {elder}and other common weeds such as {nettles and dockens.}There are also various kinds of wild flowers for example{Bluebells and Daisies,}the pollen of which attracts{flies,bees and{butterflies.}The area is also inhabited by{rabbits,moles and birds who are unpopular with the farmers because they eat crops and dig up the ground.These creatures are therefore probably destroyed by the farmers to prevent more damage.In contrast to this there is an area of conservation at{Pitmedden Gardens}where all plants and wildlife are protected by the National Trust.
